riddle: What can point in every direction but can't reach the destination by itself.
What 8 letter word can have a letter taken away and it still makes a word.  Take another letter away and it still makes a word. Keep on doing that until you have one letter left. What is the word?
answer: The word is starting! starting, staring, string, sting, sing, sin, in, I.

riddle: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
David's father has three sons : Snap, Crackle and _____ ?
What room do ghosts avoid?
What has many keys, but can't even open a single door?
You live in a one story house made entirely of redwood. What color would the stairs be?
answer: What stairs? You live in a one story house

riddle: I am taken from a mine, and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost everybody.
A man rode out of town on Sunday, he stayed a whole night at a hotel and rode back to town the next day on Sunday. How is this possible?
What is black when you buy it, red when you use it, and gray when you throw it away?
What belongs to you, but other people use it more than you?
Tall I am young, Short I am old, While with life I glow, Wind is my foe. What am I?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
What is more useful when it is broken?
They have not flesh, nor feathers, nor scales, nor bone. Yet they have fingers and thumbs of their own. What are they?
What has six faces, But does not wear makeup. It also has twenty-one eyes, But cannot see?
Before Mount Everest was discovered, what was the highest mountain on Earth?
How do you spell candy in 2 letters ?
What did Mrs. Claus say to Santa when she looked up in the sky?
This is as light as a feather, yet no man can hold it for long. What am I?
How do you make the number 7 an even number without addition, subtraction, multiplication or division?
I am full of holes but I can still hold water. What am I?
What does a snowman like to eat for breakfast?
What travels around the world but stays in one spot?
have a little house in which I live all alone. It has no doors or windows, and if I want to go out I must break through the wall. What am I?
Five apples are in a basket. How do you divide them among five girls so that each girl gets an apple, but one apple remains in the basket?
answer: Give the fifth girl her apple in the basket

riddle: What 7 letter word is spelled the same way backwards and forewords?
I can be cracked, I can be made. I can be told, I can be played. What am I?
What do mathematics teachers like to eat?
A farmer has 17 sheep and all but 9 die. How many are left alive?
Flat as a leaf, round as a ring; Has two eyes, can't see a thing. What is it?
A box without hinges, key or lid, Yet golden treasure inside is hid. What am I?
What goes up but never comes down?
Look in my face, I am somebody; Look in my back, I am nobody. What am I?
Until I am measured I am not known, Yet how you miss me when I have flown.  What Am I?
What runs without legs?
What weighs more? A pound of feathers or a pound of stones?
I am white when I am dirty, and black when I am clean. What am I?
If you drop me, I'm sure to crack. Give me a smile, and I'll always smile back. What am I?
Why can't the world ever come to an end?
Where do you take a sick boat?
I have two hands, but I can not scratch myself. What am I?
What type of music do rabbits listen to?
No matter how little or how much you use me, you change me every month. What am I?
What has a heart but no other organs?
What four-legged animal can jump higher than a house?
I pass before the sun, yet make no shadow. What am I?
What is so delicate that saying its name breaks it?
